citation.article-title: Aequorivita gen. nov., a member of the family Flavobacteriaceae isolated from terrestrial and marine Antarctic habitats.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Aequorivita antarctica sp. nov.
Aequorivita antarctica (ant.arc'ti.ca. N.L. fem. n. antarctica from Antarctica)
The description is the same as that of the genus unless specified otherwise.
Cells appear as rods or short filaments in young cultures (0.5-20.0x0.2-0.3 μm).
Forms bright-orange colonies.
Requires sodium ions for growth (at least 0.5% NaCl).
Tolerates 6% NaCl and grows weakly in 10% NaCl.
No growth occurs in the presence of 1% ox-bile salts.
Detectable levels of acid are not produced from carbohydrates; however, most strains can utilize D-glucose as a sole carbon and energy source in the presence of 0.02% yeast extract.
Arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase and ornithine decarboxylase are negative.
Nitrate is not reduced.
Hydrogen sulfide is not formed from lcysteine.
Hydrolyses starch, aesculin, L-tyrosine (no diffusible pigment), Tween 80 and gelatin.
Strains may also hydrolyse urea and elastin.
Unable to hydrolyse agar, cellulose, carboxymethylcellulose (CMC), xylan, alginate, dextran, DNA, tributyrin, urate or xanthine.
Lipase (olive oil) and lecithinase are not produced.
Produces alkaline phosphatase.

Some strains can form α-glucosidase or α-galactosidase, but do not produce α-arabinosidase, β-galactosidase, 6-phospho-β-galactosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-fucosidase or N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.
The G+C content of cells is 38-39 mol%.
The type strain is strain SW49T (=ACAM 640T=DSM 14231T), which was isolated from under-ice sea water of Prydz Bay, Antarctica.
